content: I don't think too many people in America will run out and buy a Chinese made car in this country just yet. Maybe a few at first but they will wait to see how good they are first. I'm getting a new 2010 Prius from Toyota around Sept. or Oct. New solar roof and 50 mpg is not to shabby. Not to mention it has the "Toyota" name on it which is associated with quality.

content: We have all been buying parts for cars from china for some time. Wiring harnesses are the most prominent I think. The saddest part is that why they are making cars for Americans, immediate feedback will be given to the manufacture streamlining their learning process. Very very soon their cars will become better in quality than our own because they will be able to afford it after we show them how. If they were to be left on their own they would focus on the cheap cars to come under costs. After we show/teach them that Americans want quality cars, then they will go that route. Paying what per man-hour will afford them to have a better car for less. The last obstacle has just been removed thanks to greed/political hacking

content: I've been one of those that through life have made the usual Ford joke but I bought a 2009 Ford Ranger 4X4 Off Road and beside the fact Ford is doing well without any bailout money or filing bankruptcy, I'm very please with my purchase. As for buying chink, buying a part is hidden, the name and model will be in plain view for all to see who is american and who is ordering takee wayee in secret.

content: givin the fact ford sent my job to mexico, i won't be buying anything not made atleast 90% in america! i try my best to steer away from anything made in china, i don't shop at wal mart, or sam's. i do look at the tags and if it's made in america or canada, i'll buy it, but i shop around and try to find american made. i can't see a chinese made car of any type parking in my driveway under any circumstances!
